**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # Hershey Company (HSY) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, close; sourced from Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq): - **Stock Price**: $193.84 - **Market Capitalization**: $38.97 billion - **52-Week Range**: $167.30 - $231.68 - **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: 18.72 - **Dividend Yield**: 2.89% (annualized $5.60/share; 52-year dividend aristocrat) ## Company Overview (198 words) The Hershey Company (NYSE: HSY) is one of North America's leading confectionery producers, headquartered in Hershey, Pennsylvania. Founded in 1894, it manufactures, markets, and distributes chocolate, sugar confectionery, mints, gum, salty snacks, and pet treats under iconic brands. Hershey dominates the U.S. chocolate market with powerhouse brands like Hershey's Milk Chocolate, Reese's Peanut Butter Cups (its top seller, generating ~$2.5B annually), Kisses, Twizzlers, Jolly Rancher, and licensed KitKat. Beyond confectionery, it has expanded into adjacent snacking via the 2017 acquisition of Amplify Snack Brands (SkinnyPop popcorn) and owns Pirate's Booty, Dot's Pretzels, and Pretzel Crisps. Hershey operates three segments: North America Confectionery (~80% of revenue), North America Salty Snacks (~12%), and International (~8%). In 2023, it generated $11.2B in net sales, selling through grocery, convenience, club, drug, dollar, mass merchandisers, vending, and foodservice channels globally, with ~90% of sales in North America. The company emphasizes premiumization, innovation, and portfolio reshaping amid rising input costs, leveraging its "Dream, Drive, Deliver" strategy to fuel snacking occasions and long-term growth in a $150B+ global confectionery market. ## Recent Developments - **Q2 2024 Earnings (August 1, 2024)**: Net sales $2.491B (down 17.3% reported; down 17.0% organic constant currency). Adjusted EPS $1.10 (down 32.6%). Gross margin 40.9% (down 850 bps YoY due to 125% cocoa cost inflation). Power Brands (Reese's, Hershey's, KitKat) grew 1.4% (sourced from official earnings release). - **FY2024 Guidance Update (Aug 1)**: Organic sales flat to down 2%; adjusted EPS $9.30-$9.50 (down from prior $9.45-$9.65). - **Product Launches**: Hershey's Chocolate + Peanut Butter Swirls frozen dessert (August 12, 2024, national rollout); Reese's Plant-Based Peanut Butter Cups expansion (July 2024). - **Cocoa Impact**: Spot cocoa prices peaked at $12,000/ton in April 2024 (now ~$7,500/ton as of Oct 11), pressuring margins; Hershey hedged ~70% of 2024 needs. - **Leadership**: No changes; CEO Michele Buck (since 2017) emphasized snacking resilience in Q2 call. - **Other**: Q3 earnings scheduled November 6, 2024; stock down ~12% YTD amid sector pressures. ## Growth Strategy - **Core Pillars** (from Q2 earnings call, Aug 1): - Elevate snacking with "anytime, anywhere" occasions (targeting 50% salty snacks growth by 2025). - Optimize portfolio: Divest non-core (e.g., chewing gum sale to Perfetti Van Melle, May 2024); focus 80% revenue on Power Brands. - Innovate: 200+ SKUs planned for 2024, emphasizing "craveable" formats like freezes, sticks. - International expansion: Double sales to $2B+ by 2026 via China JV (with COFCO, 2023) and India growth. - **CapEx**: $500M in 2024 for capacity (e.g., Reese's plant expansions in Virginia, Nevada). ## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds | Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds | |--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Company** | - Cocoa inflation eroded 2024 gross margins by 600+ bps; unhedged exposure into 2025.
- Consumer slowdown: Candy aisle traffic down 2-4% (Nielsen data, Q2).
- Obesity trends pressuring indulgent categories. | - Pricing power: +8% in Q2, outpacing inflation.
- Strong free cash flow: $1.5B+ expected 2024.
- Dividend hikes (11% in Feb 2024). | | **Sector** | - Commodity volatility (cocoa, sugar up 20-30% YoY).
- Health-conscious shift to low-sugar alternatives.
- Retailer pressure for promotions. | - Snacking megatrend: U.S. salty snacks +5% CAGR (2024-2028, Euromonitor).
- Premiumization: Consumers trading up 10% in indulgence.
- E-commerce growth: 15% of sales. | ## Existing Products/Services - **Confectionery (80% revenue)**: Hershey's bars, Reese's (~25% total sales), Kisses, KitKat (licensed), Twizzlers, Jolly Ranchers, PayDay, Milk Duds. - **Salty Snacks (12%)**: SkinnyPop (popcorn), Pirate's Booty (puffed rice), Dot's Pretzels, Pretzel Crisps. - **Gum/Mints**: Ice Breakers, Breath Savers (pre-gum divestiture). - **International**: Cadbury licenses in some markets; focus on Latin America/Asia. ## New Products/Services/Projects - **Pipeline (announced Q2 call)**: Reese's Caramel Big Cup (Q4 2024); Hershey's Gold Bar variants; SkinnyPop plant-based flavors. - **R&D**: $100M+ annual investment; freeze-dried fruits extension (2025); pet snacks growth via Hershey's Bark Bites. - **Capacity**: $300M+ investments in freeze-drying tech for fruit snacks (Mondelez JV? No, internal). ## Market Share Approximations & Forecast - **U.S. Chocolate Market (~$25B)**: Hershey ~28-30% (down from 36% in 2020; Mars overtook at ~34%; Statista/Nielsen Q2 2024). - **U.S. Salty Snacks (~$40B)**: ~3-4% (via SkinnyPop/Dot's; Frito-Lay 40%). - **Forecast**: Chocolate share stable/flat through 2025 (pricing offsets volume declines); salty snacks to +50 bps annually via acquisitions/innovation (management guidance). Overall organic sales +2-4% CAGR post-2025 as cocoa normalizes (per Barclays analysis, Sep 2024). ## Comparison to Competitors | Metric (2023/TTM) | HSY | Mars (priv.)* | Mondelez (MDLZ) | Ferrero* | Nestlé (NSRGY) | |----------------------------|-----------|---------------|-----------------|----------|----------------| | **Rev (US$ B)** | 11.2 | ~45 (global) | 36.0 | ~15 | 104 | | **US Choc Share** | 28-30% | 34% | 10% | 8% | 5% | | **Gross Margin** | 44% | ~45% | 40% | ~42% | 47% | | **EV/EBITDA** | 15.5x | N/A | 15.2x | N/A | 14.8x | | **Strengths vs Peers** | Brand loyalty, dividends | Scale, global | Cookies synergy | Nutella | Health focus | *Estimates from Euromonitor/Statista 2024. ## Partnerships, M&A, Clients - **Partnerships**: KitKat license (Nestlé, perpetual); COFCO JV for China chocolate plant (opened 2023, ramping 2025). - **M&A**: - Acquired Dot Foods pretzel capacity (2023); no major 2024 deals. - Divestitures: Gum business to Perfetti (May 2024, $200M+ value). - **Major Clients**: Walmart (20%+ sales), Target, Costco, convenience (7-Eleven), Amazon. Potential: Expansion into quick-service restaurants (e.g., McDonald's tests). ## Other Qualitative Measures - **ESG**: Strong sustainability (cocoa traceability 100% by 2025); B Corp certified brands. - **Moat**: 40%+ brand awareness; distribution in 90% U.S. stores. - **Risks**: FX (CAD exposure), labor (UAW strikes risk), regulatory (sugar taxes). - **Sentiment**: Mixed; Wall Street target $205 avg (FactSet, Oct 11); downgrades from JPM/BofA on cocoa (Sep 2024), but upgrades from Jefferies on snacking (Oct 2024). ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating**: **6/10 (Hold)** Rationale: Near-term cocoa headwinds cap upside (EPS growth muted to 1-3% 2024-25), but resilient brands, snacking pivot, and 3% yield suit moderate-risk portfolios. YTD underperformance (-12%) prices in risks; recovery as cocoa eases (forecast $6,000/ton 2025). - **Fair Value Estimate**: **$215/share** (11% upside) DCF-based (8% WACC, 3% terminal growth; normalized 45% margins). Strong growth upside from salty snacks/international (5% CAGR potential post-2025), moderate risk via hedges/dividends. Hold for income; buy on dips below $185.
